result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Stipulation for a Continuance

Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on January 17, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

[ma] Cases 22CF201 & 22CM213 called at 10:30am 

Defendant Luis D Vargas Miranda in court.  Attorney Sylvie Dahnert in court for Luis D Vargas Miranda.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Liesl Monroy sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant. 

Atty Dahnert requests a trial be scheduled in Case 22CM213, and have 22CF201 track.

Scheduling is discussed.
recess: 10:37am 
NEXT: As to Case 22CM213, (1)Status on 11/7/22 at 8:30am (2)FSSC on 1/17/23 at 3:30pm (3) Jury Trial on 1/23/23 at 8:45am 
As to Case 22CF201, (1)Status on 11/7/22 at 8:30am (2)Status on 1/17/23 at 3:30pm
amended

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Amended Bond.

[MK] cases #22CF201 and #22CM213 called at 8:43am 
Defendant Luis D Vargas Miranda in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 

Initial Appearance is held in Case #22CM213:
--the Court appoints Attorney Sylvie Dahnert as counsel on this case.
--the Court directs that the case is to be re-assigned to Branch I 
--Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--Plea of "Not Guilty" is entered; speedy trial is waived by both counsel 
--The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint 
--The Court requires a $500  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription


In Case #22CF201 the Court addresses the Defense Motion to Modify Bond; 
--ADA Teuber indicates that the State is not objecting to the Court granting an exception to the contact-prohibition for the birth of the child.
--the Court makes an exception to the contact prohibition:  with the exception that Mr. Vargas Miranda may have contact with the victim during the length of the victim's hospitalization for the birth of the common child;  he can be present with the mother and the newborn during that hospitalization connected to giving birth 
Mr. Vargas Miranda indicates that his address is: 516 Collins, Apt. #7 Road in Jefferson WI 
recess 8:57am 

NEXT:   (1) reassignment of case #22CM213 to Branch I,  (2) appointment of Attorney Dahnert as counsel in Case #22CM213, (3) Pretrial Conference on September 14th at 10:00am,  (3) Status Conference on September 29th at 10:00am
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

Pre-trial conference on August 3, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] 8:18 AM 
Defendant Luis D Vargas Miranda in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  DA Intern Haley Shelton, under the supervision of ADA Theresa Beck, appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter

Officer Taylor - sworn & testifies
--direct examination by Ms. Shelton
--cross examination by Attorney Dahnert
Arguments given by Attorney Dahnert
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Vargas Miranda committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both parties indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:42am

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on August 3rd at 9:40am,  (2) Status Conference on August 15th at 8:30am
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Luis D Vargas Miranda in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties. Attorney Dahnert requests that a preliminary hearing be scheduled at this point.

[ma] Case called at 10:55 AM 
Attorney Sylvie Dahnert appears.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Luis D Vargas Miranda does NOT appear. 
Liesl Monroy present to serve as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant.

Atty Dahnert was very recently appointed to this case, has not made contact with Mr. Miranda; requests status be set. 

DA Hall requests a stayed warrant. 

recess: 10:58am 
NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 6/10/22 at 10:00am
Adjourned initial appearance on May 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney
The Court orders repayment at the rate of $80/month until the total sum is paid; beginning 6/15/2022 & payments shall be made to the Clerk of Courts by the 15th of every month thereafter. 
Ec/pc: DA, Atty Dahnert , Def (5/9/22--ma)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Attorney Dahnert

[MK] case called at 1:56pm
Defendant Luis D Vargas Miranda in court. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter; this interpretation is by telephone. 
The Court notes that the Public Defender has filed notice that they determined that Mr. Vargas Miranda does not qualify for PD representation. 
The Court directs Mr. Vargas Miranda to go now to the Clerk of Courts Office, Room 115, to complete and file a petition form for the appointment of counsel.  The Court directs that Attorney Sylvie Dahnert will be appointed as counsel for the Defendant. 
recess 2:01pm

NEXT: (1) appointment of Attorney Dahnert as counsel,  (2)  Adjourned Initial Appearance (status-of-counsel hearing, and the Court needs to address preliminary hearing time limits) on May 20th at 10:30am

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: SPD Determination of Eligibility -- NOT ELIGIBLE
Adjourned initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 2:24pm 
Defendant Luis D Vargas Miranda in court, in custody, with Attorney Amber Rumpf (Attorney Rumpf appears as a friend of the Court; the PD has not completed an eligibility determination). ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sylvie Dahnert is sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
Attorney Rumpf indicates that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct. The address is corrected as to the apartment number; the correct apartment number is Apt. #7. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given
The Court schedules the case for a status-of-counsel hearing.  The Court orders Mr. Vargas Miranda to go to the Public Defenders Office by 12:00 noon tomorrow, April 27th, to apply for PD representation. 

The Court requires a $2,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence toward anyone 
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at Victim 1's residence
recess 2:31 pm 

NEXT:   Status Conference (status-of-counsel-hearing) on May 3rd at 1:30pm [JA- also schedule the case for AIA- the Court needs to address prelim time limits]
